job_title: Mental Health Therapist in Olympia, WA
pros: flexible schedule to meet my needs

Everyone is so friendly! I felt so welcome on the very first day. Each person I have interacted with has been supportive and helpful. They have provided lots of opportunities to learn from them. I have been given great opportunities to gain extra certifications as well already
cons: I wouldn't say there are any cons so far. Lots of people complain about pay, but community health care is not a place to get rich, it's a place to do good for your community. There are plenty of opportunities to make money in mental health elsewere. Also many people have complained about management. I think that really depends on the team you end up working with. they aren't all the same in a agency this big.

pros: Having the opportunity to help most disadvantaged population. Decent benefit package (excluding wages).
cons: Low pay, large case loads, mountains of paperwork as agency is funded by Medicaid funds. High employee turnover.,

review_title: Should be run as a cooperative
pros:
I worked night shift at Harvest Home, the residential treatment center for moms and babies. I loved the clients, making breakfast, doing meds, providing night assistance with the littles so moms could get some sleep. My coworkers - the ones who were frontline support staff like me - were wonderful, but management had some real issues. I brought up issues of short staffing, aggressive/arrogant management style, and unnecessary lost opportunities to collaborate between caregiving staff and clinical staff, and in the end was fired just before I received my back vacation pay, but only after I’d fully organized a 10pg manual for the job so whoever came after me could do a better job.

I loved that the very diverse staff was all-female.
cons:
Management tried to control every little tiny thing, there was no room for initiative even to keep the place running smoothly. When we were short-staffed and I stayed late to help day shift, I was called out and embarrassed publicly in a staff meeting for doing too much, when every one of my coworkers had privately thanked me for stepping up in a time of need. I understand some of the reasons for management’s hyper vigilance, considering the clientele Harvest Home serves, but cracking down on their people does not help. There’s a strong tendency to work their people til they burn out and to not trust input from caregiving staff despite us having closer relationships with the clients.

I did recommend this job to a friend, and she quit on her second day after management left her to a full shift in a residential environment with hard-drug-recovering strangers, alone.

job_title: RN Case Manager in Hoquiam, WA
pros: Meeting the variety of clients, mastering good listening skills, while obtaining a good pulse of the community you are involved with.
cons: Being able to leave the sadness behind at the end of the day.

pros: Medical benefits were paid for, although not great, this was nice to not have an extra expenses immediate clinical supervisors were wonderful.
cons:
Pay. Barely making more than the clients we are helping. Upper management cares nothing about staff or clients. Even with repeated attempts to communicate concerns, upper management was not receptive and was unwilling to adjust unrealistic expectations. They treat staff as replaceable and do not care that they are part of the reason many have left the field. 

CEO is tone deaf and very disconnected from the reality that both staff, mainly clinicians, and clients deal with every day. She is unwilling to listen to feedback and criticism.

review_title: Best  Employer I have ever had  in my  professional life
job_title: Community&Corrections Integration Liaison in Olympia, WA
pros: The company provides great benefits  of  free health insurance and retirement package. The management is supportive and  regards you as a professional ,  is willing to listen  and meet the needs of the employees. It is not overbearing  looking for errors but  instead always looking for how to support you. The work environment is friendly and I enjoy the support of my co workers  I therefore are looking forward to come to work every day and enjoy  doing my work . I am allowed to work my own daily schedule and my coworkers are very supportive; whereby we have bi weekly staff meetings where we share snacks.  I have enjoyed the twice yearly pay raises.   I would rate this employer as the best I have ever had in all my professional life
cons: when an employees program  becomes unfunded, one can always take another  job  in the company   which is  very good so one is not laid off . The downside of it though is that  one  may have to take a pay cut as the new position  may not be paying the same amount as  one was getting

pros: I looked a long time for a place that I could feel I was contributing to something wonderful using my accounting skills. I love BHR and the people I work with. Each year we honor clients and clinicians that have gone above and beyond and accomplished something special. There is not a day I don't look forward to going to work.
cons: Depends on what you are looking for. Yes, salary levels may be lower, we are a nonprofit. However the benefits package is strong and (for me) carries a high value. We are forever looking for folks to join our team and with the current availability of clinical staff - sometimes our people just have to do a lot to take care of our clients.

job_title: Child and Family Therapist in Shelton, WA
pros:
BHR is the place to. The energy that runs here is great.  The staff truly care for each other and support each other. Our leadership is down to earth and very supportive. One truly enjoys the spirit here at BHR. I am very proud to be part of this great Mission. We truly see our clients in an honest and sincere way and work together to offer them any support they need. 
Thank you BHR. I am a proud member of our TEAM.
cons: None that I can identify at this time

pros: Some great, very dedicated co-workers. Decent benefits.
cons: Short staffing is a constant problem that management ignores and leaves staff to deal with the results. This results in staff  being left alone on the floor with dangerous mental patients and or without adequate staff to manage assaultive patients. Management constantly micromanages and nit picks staff's every move while hiring unqualified friends and relatives to work as Mental Health Aides. Pay is low for the level of skill and danger involved in the job. Staff only get paid once a month, recent employee strike, sometimes paid late.

review_title: Most Dysfunctional place I have ever worked.
pros: Decent benefits, dedicated and skilled coworkers.
cons: Low pay and high stress. Unsafe working conditions at the ETU due to constant short staffing and turnover. If you get injured by a patient there the management will blame you and will try to deny your workman's comp claim. Management likes to hire unskilled and inexperienced people for highly skilled positions. Especially the friends and family members of the management. Working at  Subway and the Post Office is not adequate training for counseling adults with severe mental illness in a locked psych unit.

pros:
Dedicated colleagues. They are unappreciated but still dedicated.
We are payed sometimes on time.
Magnificent smoking shelter for patients.
Vending machines.
cons:
Management knows nothing about acuity guidelines
Unfair to immigrant  applicants for job promotions.
Nonclinical staff managing clinical staff without certification or any specific educational background.
Manager who hires inexperienced but attractive managers who work under his decision making process .
Manager who refuses to follow national standards and antagonize older and more experienced nurses

pros: Leadership is inspiring, committed and truly cares about clients and staff. Benefits are great and the people are hard working and kind. The team work is above and beyond, as well as the quality of work.
cons: I can't think of any cons.

review_title: not a bad place to start
pros: good people to work with, decent work environment for  the most part.  way too much emphasis on paperwork, and not so much on process
cons: supervisors are more concerned with perfect documentation that with patient care

review_title: A non-profit with a great mission!
pros: The leadership and staff I work with seem to sincerely care about the mission of the organization and the clients they serve.
cons: This is a non-profit organization so the wages may be on the lower side which is expected.

pros: Lots of learning opportunities, supervision towards licensure, great benefits, supportive managers. There’s even an employer contribution towards student loans!
cons: Paperwork but it’s no different than any other agency.

pros: Great co-workers that are dedicated to serving the needs of the client(s).
cons: Fairly low wages for the skill set required for the position.

pros: Working with the under served population of Mason County.
cons: Hostile work environment. Petty jealous coworkers who only work to cover there lack of knowledge. OS staff never have meetings and the lack of communication directly effects a persons ability to serve the public.

pros: Highly Qualified Clinical Staff with Free Parking.
cons: Greedy management driving company into ground with bad decisions (buildings over people) and letting good people go to hide their secrets.
